page.title: 07SHOPPING
page.content: ABOUT ONCE OR TWICE A MONTH, MANY PEOPLE IN OUR AREA GO SHOPPING TO A BIG SUPERSTORE IN EDINBURGH CALLED ASDA. OTHERS GO TO PENICUIK OR PEEBLES WHICH ARE NEARER, OR EVEN TO OUR LOCAL VILLAGE OF WEST LINTON. THOSE WHO DO NOT HAVE CARS DEPEND ON THE VANS COMING ROUND TO DELIVER THINGS TO THEM. WE HAVE LOTS OF VANS VISITING OUR FARM. THE GROCER COMES TWICE A WEEK AND SELLS MOST THINGS. THERE IS A FISHMONGER WHO ALSO SELLS FRUIT, AN ICE-CREAM MAN WHO ALSO SELLS SWEETS, AND A FISH AND CHIP MAN COMES EVERY WEEK. EVERY MORNING A MILKMAN CALLS AND DELIVERS MILK FROM THE LOCAL DAIRY. NEWSPAPERS ARE DELIVERED FROM THE NEWSAGENT IN WEST LINTON. OUR FREEZERS ARE WELL-STOCKED. MOST OF US HAVE GARDENS AND PLENTY OF FRESH VEGETABLES AND FRUIT IN SEASON, AND WE FREEZE THE SURPLUS.
